Basic details: Emily Johnson, a 19-month-old girl, is brought to the clinic by her parents due to a fever that started two days ago.
Vitals:
Temp: 102.2°F (39°C)
HR: 130/minute
RR: 30/minute
BP: 90/60 mm Hg
Physical presentation: Appear lethargic and cling to the parent. Exhibit flushed cheeks and a runny nose. Occasionally tug at the ear. If the examinee mentions a throat examination, act fussy and resist opening the mouth.
Challenging question: "Does she have an ear infection? Will she need antibiotics?"
